questions.question_text:
The CUSTOMER table in the T1 database is accidentally dropped.

Which privileges are required to restore this table? (Choose two.)
A stream object will advance its offset when it is used in which statement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/streams-intro
Note

To advance the offset of a stream to the current table version without consuming the change data in a DML operation, complete either of the following actions:
Recreate the stream (using the CREATE OR REPLACE STREAM syntax).

Insert the current change data into a temporary table. In the INSERT statement, query the stream but include a WHERE clause that filters out all of the change data (e.g. WHERE 0 = 1).

choices.B: The use of Secure Data Sharing among Snowflake accounts.
choices.C: A Virtual Private Network (VPN) between a user and Snowflake.
choices.D: A secure, direct connection to Snowflake that does not use the internet.
choices.A: The isolation of data within a Snowflake account.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
AWS PrivateLink is an AWS service for creating private VPC endpoints that allow direct, secure connectivity between your AWS VPCs and the Snowflake VPC without traversing the public Internet. The connectivity is for AWS VPCs in the same AWS region
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/admin-security-privatelink
Azure Private Link provides private connectivity to Snowflake by ensuring that access to Snowflake is through a private IP address. Traffic can only occur from the customer virtual network (VNet) to the Snowflake VNet using the Microsoft backbone and avoids the public Internet
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/privatelink-azure

questions.question_text: What does an integration between Snowflake and Microsoft Private Link or AWS PrivateLink support?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - scoped and pre-signed have an expiration timer

Selected Answer: D
We learn that External Stages are used for these kinds of files. Hence, all the files are stored on the Cloud Storage, due to the fact that External Tables points to the specific space in Cloud Storage. And, since, it is about permanent access, I would say that the right answer is D. File URLs are the only ones with permanent, or long time access. The PRE-SIGNED URL, the access is available till the availability time exceeds.

questions.question_text: Which type of URL gives permanent access to files in cloud storage?
Which Snowflake data governance feature supports resource usage monitoring?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
object tagging is the data governance feature that enables tracking sensitive data and facilitates resource usage monitoring, along with compliance, discovery, and protection.
